column2: sdavidek1, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: My husband had a stroke and since then wakes every 2 to 2-1/2 hour in the night to urinate.  At the rehab center the doctor ordered this medication, he is still up every 2 to 2-1/2 hours to urinate and sometimes every hour.  We will talk to his primary doctor at his next appointment.

column2: antandie, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
maryjo, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Have had stomach problems, extreme sleepiness, fever, swelling of hands and legs, pounding heartbeat, and blurred vision. I went to doctor to report all of the above not connecting these problems with the drug Oxybutynin. My doctor apparently did not connect also and wanted to put me on an antidepressent! I checked webmd for any side effects to this drug and found all of the above to be connected. I have suffered greatly for many weeks. I hope going off the medication with return me to my normal life even if I have urinary incontinence.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The dry mouth is the worst experience. And a funny taste in my mouth.

column2: george pakis, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: keeps me up at night..

column2: Gemstone, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had frequent UTI's & also IC (interstitial cystitis). Anyway, this drugwork rather well, but it takes 2-3 hourstil it kicks in. I am going to try takingit at 6 a.m. when I first go to the bathroom.

column2: Deweyguy, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After taking for a few days the frequency of night time urinations decreased.  After several weeks I noticed a very dry mouth and a change of taste in foods.  Continured use resulted in sore gums and tongue.  I have now discontinured taking the drug and frequent urinations have returned and I am waiting to see if the dry mouth and taste changes disapear.

column2: Mary, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: have been taking this drug for months and wake up wet all night. Have to get up 3 times to urinate. Feel I am wasting my money on this drug.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have to keep a towel besides my pillow because sometimes when I get up in the middle of the night I can hardly hold it in. I put the towel between my legs till I reach the toilet. I may need a stronger dose.

column2: 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years
column9: Ditropan XL 15 has been the most successfulmedicine to help with my overactive bladder. I've tried the generic, Oxybuton, to save money, but I experienced dizziness; lately my mail order pharmacy changed me to Enablex.  I tried it for one month, but it didn't help at all.  My physician just wrote me a new prescription for Ditropan; however, it's hard to locate a pharmacy that carries it now.

column2: Donna, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medication for 3 months, and it hasn't worked for me.  I tried Detrol LA first, and that didn't work either.  I was told to take 3 pills per day now of the Ditropan to see if that works.  I will post results in a few months.

column2: catskattery, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been having leg cramps since taking this drug, not sure this problem is related but am doing research. The longer I take the drug the worse the cramps.

column2: sara, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medication daily for years. Probably 10 or more. I am 52 years old. I have a very poor memory, long term insomnia, and have had problems develop in the last year of depression and anxiety. Also I have developed acid reflux problems. I have just learned of the potential side effects for this drug. I am alarmed that my dr did not advise me of these even when I reported these problems. I am now taking myself off these drugs. I would rather wear depends.

column2: MRSDJMCW, 35-44 Female  (Patient)
column9: I have had this condition (frequent urination) on and off for over 20 years. This medicine gave me my life back. When I first went on it, I almost gave up...but stuck with it and finally got effective relief after several weeks of regular use.My husband and I like to attend outdoor concerts, car shows, etc. and it is difficult to enjoy when I am constantly looking for a bathroom. Sometimes the lines for the porta-potty was so long,I'd miss half the concert. I would avoid drinking anything, but even that did not help with the urgency feeling that haunted me. My gynecologist started me on this med and I am forever grateful.    Thanks to ditropan for making life carefree and enjoyable.    The only side effect is a VERY dry mouth and lips, but drinking water helps,and doesn't make me run to the bathroom anymore. I wish I could have had this 20 years ago!!

column2: Eric B., 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with Chronic Pelvic Pain Syndrome 4 years ago or Chronic non-bacterial prostasis. The 1st drug I tried that helped was Ditropan. At first I took 5mg twice daily after a few months the dry mouth began to go away. The drug worked great for about one year, then I started getting abdominal pain and eventually the drug stopped working altogether. I still take this drug periodically when I have flare-ups or just need something to make the feeling that I have to urinate go away for a day. However, these days the drug only works for a few days and the side effectas and abdominal pain comes back. I don't know if this information will help anyone. I was just wondering if anybody has had a similar experience. It feels like my body has built up a tolerance to this drug. I can be reached at anaheimshaolin@yahoo.com

column2: Allysa, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was put on this medicine for my IC and I love it! It is my pain pill because it helps with the pain soo much! I take 1 10mg a day and I can't live without it as I won't be able to walk or do any activities with my kids if it wasn't for this medicine! I am very happy with this med as I can't take Elmiron because of the side effects, but I watch my diet and take this regularly and I hope my IC gets better over time!

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Ditropan for 2-years.  I can set through meetings and not worry. Other than occasional constipation this drug works for me.  It is too expensive.

column2: MamaWade, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medication for over 10 years with great success.  The side affects are only slightly annoying - extreme thirst, sleepiness - but are a small price to pay for the ability to function normally.  Have developed Dry Eye Syndrome in the last 6 months and am not sure if it is related to the long-term use of the drug or not.

column2: Vicky Lee, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have taken this med for about 5 years.  I have lost most of my teeth, the dentist said it will try all of the mositure from your teeth and that is what happening.  We need to drink water for are teeth.  This is something I never knew.  I have lost all moisture in my fingertips and bottom of my feet.  I cannot turn a page with my finger without using something to help me.  And constipation, also another issue.  And lastly I have pains in  my head.  I had a MRI and my vessels in my brain are very small.  And swelling with leg pains.  This med has been a total train wreck.  Destroying everything it can.

column2: Shirley, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication for a year.  It has given me my life back.  I couldn't go anywhere unless I knew where the bathroom was.  I couldn't take walks with my husband because I couldn't hold it.

column2: Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Inititally I was treated with a 5mg pill taken 3 x daily. So I asked my doctor for a once a day pill and rec'd. the 10mg er (extended release) and I am experiencing good results as of day two.

column2: pagecat2, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It has made me go more

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Prescibed to me for pain after urination.  Frequent and sudden need to urinate.  It caused severe cramps and did not help my condition.  I took it for a week and stopped. I am just living with my condition for now.
